# List of Test cricket hat-tricks

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

[![A side shoot of a white-skinned man holding a champagne bottle in his
hand](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/Stuart_Broad3.JPG/220px-
Stuart_Broad3.JPG)](/wiki/File:Stuart_Broad3.JPG)

[](/wiki/File:Stuart_Broad3.JPG "Enlarge")

[English cricketer](/wiki/England_cricket_team "England cricket team") [Stuart
Broad](/wiki/Stuart_Broad "Stuart Broad") took [hat-tricks](/wiki/Hat-trick
"Hat-trick") against [India](/wiki/India_national_cricket_team "India national
cricket team") at [Trent Bridge](/wiki/Trent_Bridge "Trent Bridge") in 2011[1]
and against [Sri Lanka](/wiki/Sri_Lanka_national_cricket_team "Sri Lanka
national cricket team") at [Headingley](/wiki/Headingley_Cricket_Ground
"Headingley Cricket Ground") in 2014.

In the sport of [cricket](/wiki/Cricket "Cricket"), a [hat-trick](/wiki/Hat-
trick "Hat-trick") is an occasion where a [bowler](/wiki/Bowler_\(cricket\)
"Bowler \(cricket\)") takes three [wickets](/wiki/Wicket "Wicket") in
consecutive [deliveries](/wiki/Delivery_\(cricket\) "Delivery \(cricket\)").
As of 31 July 2017, this feat has only been achieved 43 times in more than two
thousand [Test matches](/wiki/Test_cricket "Test cricket"),[2] the form of the
sport in which national representative teams compete in matches of up to five
days' duration. The first Test hat-trick was recorded on 2 January 1879, in
only the third Test match to take place, by the
[Australian](/wiki/Australian_cricket_team "Australian cricket team") pace
bowler [Fred Spofforth](/wiki/Fred_Spofforth "Fred Spofforth"), nicknamed "The
Demon Bowler", who dismissed three [English](/wiki/English_cricket_team
"English cricket team") [batsmen](/wiki/Batsman "Batsman") with consecutive
deliveries at the [Melbourne Cricket Ground](/wiki/Melbourne_Cricket_Ground
"Melbourne Cricket Ground"). The most recent bowler to achieve the feat was
[English](/wiki/England_cricket_team "England cricket team") spin bowler
[Moeen Ali](/wiki/Moeen_Ali "Moeen Ali") against South Africa on 31 July 2017.
At least one bowler from each of the ten nations that have played Test cricket
have taken a Test hat-trick.[3]

A player has taken two hat-tricks in the same Test match only once. Playing
for Australia against [South Africa](/wiki/South_African_cricket_team "South
African cricket team") in the first match of the [1912 Triangular
Tournament](/wiki/1912_Triangular_Tournament "1912 Triangular Tournament") at
[Old Trafford](/wiki/Old_Trafford_Cricket_Ground "Old Trafford Cricket
Ground"), [Manchester](/wiki/Manchester "Manchester"), England, [leg
spinner](/wiki/Leg_spin "Leg spin") [Jimmy Matthews](/wiki/Jimmy_Matthews
"Jimmy Matthews") took a hat-trick in South Africa's first and second innings,
both taken on 28 May 1912. He completed both hat-tricks by dismissing South
Africa's [Tommy Ward](/wiki/Tommy_Ward_\(cricketer\) "Tommy Ward
\(cricketer\)").[4] Only three other cricketers have taken more than one Test
hat-trick: Australian [off spinner](/wiki/Off_spin "Off spin") [Hugh
Trumble](/wiki/Hugh_Trumble "Hugh Trumble") (two years apart, between the same
teams at the same ground), [Pakistani](/wiki/Pakistani_cricket_team "Pakistani
cricket team") fast bowler [Wasim Akram](/wiki/Wasim_Akram "Wasim Akram")
(just over a week apart, in consecutive matches between the same teams) and
[English](/wiki/English_cricket_team "English cricket team") fast bowler
[Stuart Broad](/wiki/Stuart_Broad "Stuart Broad"). Three players have taken a
hat-trick on their Test debut: English medium pace bowler [Maurice
Allom](/wiki/Maurice_Allom "Maurice Allom") in 1930, New Zealand off-spinner
[Peter Petherick](/wiki/Peter_Petherick "Peter Petherick") in 1976, and
Australian pace bowler [Damien Fleming](/wiki/Damien_Fleming "Damien Fleming")
in 1994.[3] [Geoff Griffin](/wiki/Geoff_Griffin "Geoff Griffin") took the
fewest total Test wickets of any player who recorded a hat-trick, taking only
eight wickets in his entire Test career.[3] During the match in which he took
his hat-trick, Griffin was repeatedly [called for
throwing](/wiki/Throwing_\(cricket\) "Throwing \(cricket\)") by the umpires
and never bowled again in a Test match.[5] Australian [Peter
Siddle](/wiki/Peter_Siddle "Peter Siddle") is the only bowler to take a hat-
trick on his birthday,[6] and
[Bangladeshi](/wiki/Bangladesh_national_cricket_team "Bangladesh national
cricket team") off spinner [Sohag Gazi](/wiki/Sohag_Gazi "Sohag Gazi") is the
only player to score a century and take a hat-trick in the same Test match.[7]

Australian [Merv Hughes](/wiki/Merv_Hughes "Merv Hughes") is the only bowler
to take a hat-trick where the wickets fell over three overs. He took a wicket
with the final ball of an over. With the first ball of the next over he took
the final wicket of the West Indies innings. He then removed the opener
[Gordon Greenidge](/wiki/Gordon_Greenidge "Gordon Greenidge") with the first
ball of the West Indies second innings.[8]

In the five-match series between a [Rest of the World
XI](/wiki/Rest_of_the_World_cricket_team_in_England_in_1970 "Rest of the World
cricket team in England in 1970") and England in 1970, a hat-trick was taken
by South African [Eddie Barlow](/wiki/Eddie_Barlow "Eddie Barlow") in the
fourth match, at [Headingley](/wiki/Headingley_Carnegie_Cricket_Ground
"Headingley Carnegie Cricket Ground") (the last three of four wickets in five
balls).[9] These matches were considered to be Tests at the time, but that
status was later removed.[10]

## Test hat-tricks[[edit](/w/index.php?title=List_of_Test_cricket_hat-
tricks&action=edit&section=1 "Edit section: Test hat-tricks")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9a/Fred_Spofforth.jpg/130px-
Fred_Spofforth.jpg)](/wiki/File:Fred_Spofforth.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Fred_Spofforth.jpg "Enlarge")

[Australian](/wiki/Australian_cricket_team "Australian cricket team") bowler
[Fred Spofforth](/wiki/Fred_Spofforth "Fred Spofforth") took the first [hat-
trick](/wiki/Hat-trick "Hat-trick") in [Test cricket](/wiki/Test_cricket "Test
cricket") on 2 January 1879, in only the third Test match.

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/18/WilliamBates1900.jpg/130px-
WilliamBates1900.jpg)](/wiki/File:WilliamBates1900.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:WilliamBates1900.jpg "Enlarge")

[Billy Bates](/wiki/Billy_Bates "Billy Bates") was the first player to take a
hat-trick for England, four years after Spofforth achieved the feat.

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5e/Trum.jpg/130px-
Trum.jpg)](/wiki/File:Trum.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Trum.jpg "Enlarge")

[Hugh Trumble](/wiki/Hugh_Trumble "Hugh Trumble") is one of only four players
to take more than one Test hat-trick, achieving the feat in 1902 and 1904.

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d3/Courtney_walsh.jpg/130px-
Courtney_walsh.jpg)](/wiki/File:Courtney_walsh.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Courtney_walsh.jpg "Enlarge")

[Courtney Walsh](/wiki/Courtney_Walsh "Courtney Walsh")'s hat-trick in 1988
was spread across two innings. In Australia's first innings he dismissed the
last two batsmen with consecutive deliveries and then took a third wicket with
the first ball of the second innings.

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/de/Wasim_Akram.jpg/130px-
Wasim_Akram.jpg)](/wiki/File:Wasim_Akram.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Wasim_Akram.jpg "Enlarge")

[Wasim Akram](/wiki/Wasim_Akram "Wasim Akram") took two hat-tricks in the
space of nine days in 1999.

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/PeterSiddleSCG2009.jpg/130px-
PeterSiddleSCG2009.jpg)](/wiki/File:PeterSiddleSCG2009.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:PeterSiddleSCG2009.jpg "Enlarge")

When [Peter Siddle](/wiki/Peter_Siddle "Peter Siddle") took a hat-trick for
Australia in 2010, his final victim was [Stuart Broad](/wiki/Stuart_Broad
"Stuart Broad"). Nine months later Broad himself would be the next man to take
a Test match hat-trick.

---|---  
Bowler | The name of the bowler  
For | The team for which the bowler was playing  
Against | The team against which the bowler was playing

Test | The number of the Test within the overall series between the two teams  
Dismissals | The three players dismissed by the bowler  
Venue | The venue where the hat-trick was achieved  
Date | The date on which the hat-trick was achieved  
Ref. | Reference
